016
017package org.vafer.jdeb.changes;
018
019import java.io.BufferedReader;
020import java.io.BufferedWriter;
021import java.io.IOException;
022import java.io.InputStream;
023import java.io.InputStreamReader;
024import java.io.OutputStream;
025import java.io.OutputStreamWriter;
026import java.nio.charset.Charset;
027import java.text.DateFormat;
028import java.text.ParseException;
029import java.text.SimpleDateFormat;
030import java.util.ArrayList;
031import java.util.Collection;
032import java.util.Date;
033import java.util.TimeZone;
034
035import org.vafer.jdeb.debian.BinaryPackageControlFile;
036
037/**
038 * Gets the changes from a changes file. The first entry are the current changes.
039 * The release line will be added. Example:
040 *
041 * release date=22:13 19.08.2007,version=1.5+r90114,urgency=low,by=Torsten Curdt &lt;torsten@vafer.org&gt;
042 *   * debian changes support
043 * release date=20:13 17.08.2007,version=1.4+r89114,urgency=low,by=Torsten Curdt &lt;torsten@vafer.org&gt;
044 *   * debian changes support
045 *
046 */
047public final class TextfileChangesProvider implements ChangesProvider {
048
049    private final ChangeSet[] changeSets;
050
051    private final DateFormat fmt;
052
053    @Deprecated
054    public TextfileChangesProvider( final InputStream pInput, final BinaryPackageControlFile packageControlFile ) throws IOException, ParseException {
055        this(pInput, packageControlFile, null, Charset.defaultCharset());
056    }
057
058    @Deprecated
059    public TextfileChangesProvider( final InputStream pInput, final BinaryPackageControlFile packageControlFile, final Long outputTimestampMs ) throws IOException, ParseException {
060        this(pInput, packageControlFile, outputTimestampMs, Charset.defaultCharset());
061    }
062
063    public TextfileChangesProvider( final InputStream pInput, final BinaryPackageControlFile packageControlFile, final Charset encoding ) throws IOException, ParseException {
064        this(pInput, packageControlFile, null, encoding);
065    }
066
067    public TextfileChangesProvider( final InputStream pInput, final BinaryPackageControlFile packageControlFile, final Long outputTimestampMs, final Charset encoding ) throws IOException, ParseException {
068
069        fmt = new SimpleDateFormat("HH:mm dd.MM.yyyy");
070        if (outputTimestampMs != null) {
071            fmt.setTimeZone(TimeZone.getTimeZone("UTC"));
072        }
073
074        final BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(pInput, encoding));
075
076        String packageName = packageControlFile.get("Package");
077        String version = packageControlFile.get("Version");
078        Date date = outputTimestampMs == null ? new Date() : new Date(outputTimestampMs);
079        String distribution = packageControlFile.get("Distribution");
080        String urgency = packageControlFile.get("Urgency");
081        String changedBy = packageControlFile.get("Maintainer");
082        Collection<String> changesColl = new ArrayList<>();
083        Collection<ChangeSet> changeSetColl = new ArrayList<>();
084
085
086        while (true) {
087            final String line = reader.readLine();
088            if (line == null) {
089                final String[] changes = changesColl.toArray(new String[changesColl.size()]);
090                final ChangeSet changeSet = new ChangeSet(packageName, version, date, distribution, urgency, changedBy, changes);
091                changeSetColl.add(changeSet);
092                break;
093            }
094
095            if (line.startsWith("release ")) {
096
097                if (changesColl.size() > 0) {
098                    final String[] changes = changesColl.toArray(new String[changesColl.size()]);
099                    final ChangeSet changeSet = new ChangeSet(packageName, version, date, distribution, urgency, changedBy, changes);
100                    changeSetColl.add(changeSet);
101                    changesColl.clear();
102                }
103
104                final String[] tokens = line.substring("release ".length()).split(",");
105                for (String token : tokens) {
106                    final String[] lr = token.trim().split("=");
107                    final String key = lr[0];
108                    final String value = lr[1];
109
110                    if ("urgency".equals(key)) {
111                        urgency = value;
112                    } else if ("by".equals(key)) {
113                        changedBy = value;
114                    } else if ("date".equals(key)) {
115                        date = fmt.parse(value);
116                    } else if ("version".equals(key)) {
117                        version = value;
118                    } else if ("distribution".equals(key)) {
119                        distribution = value;
120                    }
121                }
122                continue;
123            }
124
125            if (line.startsWith(" * ")) {
126                changesColl.add(line.substring(" * ".length()));
127                continue;
128            }
129
130            throw new ParseException("Unknown line syntax [" + line + "]", 0);
131        }
132
133        reader.close();
134
135        changeSets = changeSetColl.toArray(new ChangeSet[changeSetColl.size()]);
136    }
137
138    public void save(OutputStream pOutput) throws IOException {
139        BufferedWriter writer = new BufferedWriter(new OutputStreamWriter(pOutput));
140
141        for (ChangeSet changeSet : changeSets) {
142            writer.write("release ");
143            writer.write("date=" + fmt.format(changeSet.getDate()) + ",");
144            writer.write("version=" + changeSet.getVersion() + ",");
145            writer.write("urgency=" + changeSet.getUrgency() + ",");
146            writer.write("by=" + changeSet.getChangedBy() + ",");
147            writer.write("distribution=" + changeSet.getDistribution());
148            writer.write("\n");
149
150            for (String change : changeSet.getChanges()) {
151                writer.write(" * ");
152                writer.write(change);
153                writer.write("\n");
154            }
155        }
156
157        writer.close();
158    }
159
160    public ChangeSet[] getChangesSets() {
161        return changeSets;
162    }
163}
